intro: Clibadium terebinthinaceum, commonly known as the African terebinth, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is often used in traditional medicine. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
